text: The Sèvre Nantaise is a river in western France, a left tributary of the Loire river. It starts in the Deux-Sèvres department (named "Two Sèvres" after this and the Sèvre Niortaise river that flows through Niort) and ends in the city of Nantes (and is the origin of the second part of the river's name). ==Geography== The Sèvre Nantaise river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of approximately . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Nantes, where the Sèvre Nantaise joins the Loire river. It then flows to the northwest through the departments of Vendée, Maine-et-Loire and Loire-Atlantique. Finally, the river flows into the Loire river in the city of Nantes. The Sèvre Nantaise flows through 2 regions, 4 departments and 44 communes: * Nouvelle-Aquitaine region ** Deux- Sèvres: 15 communes. * Pays de la Loire region ** Vendée: 15 communes. ** Maine-et-Loire: two communes. ** Loire-Atlantique: 12 communes. ==Main tributaries == The main tributaries of the Sèvre Nantaise river are: Left tributaries: * Crûme - 22.7 km * Maine - 68.4 km Right tributaries: * Ouin - 33.7 km * Moine - 68.8 km * Sanguèze - 44 km ==Gallery== Rezé-Port Morinière.jpg|The Sèvre Nantaise in Port Morinière, Rezé Vertou pontPortillon.JPG|The Sèvre Nantaise and the Portillon bridge in Vertou Vertou châteauPortillon.jpg|The Château de Portillon and Sèvre Nantaise in Vertou Nantes-Sèvre.JPG|The Sèvre Nantaise in Nantes ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France ==References== ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Station M7502410 - La Sèvre Nantaise à Nantes * Visite virtuelle du basin de la Sèvre Nantaise Category:Rivers of Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:Rivers of Pays de la Loire
title: Sèvre Nantaise
